page.title: 14OWLERTON STADIUM
page.content: As you approach Owlerton Stadium it looks shabby. It is surrounded by steelworks with a huge carpark in front. Inside it is a lot nicer with a souvenir shop and snack bars. From the Panorama bar you have a good view of the stadium. It is oval shaped, which Mr Carter says is the best for high speeds. Greyhound, stock-car and speedway racing use the 420 metre track. In the middle, which is all grass, there is rugby league and next year American Football. The stadium holds about 12000 people comfortably, with many exits in case of fire. It costs about Â£8000 a week to run with high rates and is only breaking even at the moment. The grey hounds are nice, soft and gentle to stroke and not ferocious.
